dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, you know, we've been hearing a lot about, like, trade wars and tensions with China, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, you know, we've been hearing a lot about, like, trade wars and tensions with China, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. It's been non-stop, especially with, uh, the rhetoric.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. It's been non-stop, especially with, uh, the rhetoric.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then I saw this article, and it's like... things are actually looking surprisingly positive?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then I saw this article, and it's like... things are actually looking surprisingly positive?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The politics between Beijing and Washington are not improving.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, President Trump was just, like, praising China last week, saying they're committed to free and fair elections! [chuckles]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, President Trump was just, like, praising China last week, saying they're committed to free and fair elections!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice President Mike Pence launched a cannonball across the bow of Chinas ship of state last week. He said the country was meddling in the midterm elections.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And economic cooperation. And get this: the administration is actually planning to loosen some sanctions? Under that 2017 act?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And economic cooperation. And get this: the administration is actually planning to loosen some sanctions? Under that twenty seventeen act?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If China was meddling, it sets the table for Washington to sanction them under two new executive orders signed by Trump and the August 2017 Countering Americas Adversaries Through Sanctions Act.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. I thought they were, um, tightening everything. So, things are really improving, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. I thought they were, um, tightening everything. So, things are really improving, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently so. And the markets are, like, totally delighted. September's been great for stocks, especially China A-shares. Up 22% year-to-date!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently so. And the markets are, like, totally delighted. September's been great for stocks, especially China A-shares. Up twenty two percent year-to-date!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: September is living up to its reputation as not the greatest month for stoc... The China A-shares (ASHR) are down over 22% year-to-date, a sorry state of affairs for dozens of U.S. mutual funds...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's huge! So, uh, Pompeo, Secretary of State, he's actually making progress with his Chinese counterparts?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's huge! So, uh, Pompeo, Secretary of State, he's actually making progress with his Chinese counterparts?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Top diplomats on both sides said Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was getting nowhere with this Chinese counterparts. He said they were fundamental disagreements over a range of issues...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, they're saying he's making substantial progress on, like, a whole range of issues. Wang Yi, the Chinese Foreign Minister, even praised Washington for trying to, um, cooperate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, they're saying he's making substantial progress on, like, a whole range of issues. Wang Yi, the Chinese Foreign Minister, even praised Washington for trying to, um, cooperate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi accused Washington of escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and leveling false accusations against China regarding election interference and inserting chips in Apple products in order to spy on U.S. companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And debunking those accusations about election interference and, uh, those spy chips in Apple products?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And debunking those accusations about election interference and, uh, those spy chips in Apple products?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi accused Washington of escalating the trade conflict, interfering with Taiwan, and leveling false accusations against China regarding election interference and inserting chips in Apple products in order to spy on U.S. companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. He said it's helping mutual trust. But here’s the kicker: China actually views Trump’s policies as a *boon* to their economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. He said it's helping mutual trust. But here's the kicker: China actually views Trump's policies as a boon to their economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These actions [have hurt] our mutual trust, and cast a shadow over the future of China-U.S. relations, he was quoted saying yesterday by the South China Morning Post. ... It has finally come to pass that China views Trumps policies against it as economic warfare.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Wait, a *boon*? Like, a positive thing? How?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, a boon? Like, a positive thing? How?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, apparently some provinces are feeling positive impacts. And their policymakers are being super proactive, not reactive, injecting, like, $110 billion into the economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, apparently some provinces are feeling positive impacts. And their policymakers are being super proactive, not reactive, injecting, like, one hundred ten billion dollars into the economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Finance Minister Liu Kun said that some provinces are feeling the impact of the trade war. ... Macquarie Capital economists Larry Hu and Irene Wu wrote in a recent note that Chinese policymakers remain reactive, not proactive in conducting stimulus...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're just, uh, riding it out and finding ways to benefit? That's... unexpected.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're just, uh, riding it out and finding ways to benefit? That's... unexpected.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And even the Business 20 group, that international advisory group, they were praising Beijing for the role of state-owned enterprises.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And even the Business twenty group, that international advisory group, they were praising Beijing for the role of state-owned enterprises.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Business 20, an international business advisory group affiliated with the Group of 20, blasted Beijing over the role of state-owned enterprises in the world economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. I guess, you know, despite all the noise, at their core, both economies are still, like, free-market capitalist in a way. So maybe some things just stay the same.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. I guess, you know, despite all the noise, at their core, both economies are still, like, free-market capitalist in a way. So maybe some things just stay the same.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...on one side you have free market capitalism as the No. 1 economy and on the other, you have a largely closed market Communist economy as the worlds No. 2.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a fascinating twist in the narrative, for sure. We'll have to see how long this, uh, positive glow lasts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a fascinating twist in the narrative, for sure. We'll have to see how long this, uh, positive glow lasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Interesting times, as always.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Interesting times, as always.
